label: Multi-Channel Feedback Collection
description: Omnichannel feedback collection across SMS, email, app, and web with journey-triggered surveys achieving 35-50% response rates vs 10-20% for email-only approaches.

traditional.workflow: 1. Marketing team creates post-purchase email survey. 2. Survey sent to all customers 3 days after purchase. 3. Generic survey with 10-15 questions (takes 5-10 minutes). 4. 10-20% response rate due to email fatigue and survey length. 5. No feedback collected at other journey touchpoints.
constraints: Email-only channel limits reach (50% email open rates)
Post-purchase only (missing critical touchpoints like checkout, delivery)
10-20% response rate means 80-90% of customer voice unheard
Long surveys (10-15 questions) cause abandonment
Generic timing (3 days) doesn't match customer context
No personalization of survey content or questions

agentic.workflow: 1. Feedback Collection Agent identifies optimal feedback moments across journey: post-purchase, post-delivery, post-service, post-browse. 2. Channel Optimization Agent selects best channel per customer: SMS for mobile-first, email for desktop, in-app for app users. 3. Agent delivers micro-surveys (2-3 questions) at the moment of experience. 4. Agent personalizes questions based on customer journey path and touchpoints experienced. 5. Trigger Engine activates surveys based on journey events (delivery confirmed, support case closed).
dataSources: Customer journey data and touchpoint history
Survey response history by channel and timing
Customer contact information (email, phone, app ID)
benefits: 35-50% response rate vs 10-20% (15-30 pt improvement)
Omnichannel reach (SMS 90% open rate, in-app 80% engagement)
Journey-triggered surveys capture feedback at moment of experience
Micro-surveys (2-3 questions) reduce abandonment
5-10x more touchpoint coverage vs post-purchase only
Personalized questions increase relevance and completion

quickWins: Add SMS survey channel for high-value customers
prerequisites: SMS gateway and mobile app integration

label: Sentiment & Text Analytics
description: NLP analysis of 100% of feedback vs manual review of 5-10% with 95%+ accuracy in theme extraction and sentiment classification through AI-powered text analytics.

traditional.workflow: 1. Customer submits open-ended survey comments. 2. Analyst samples 5-10% of comments for manual review. 3. Analyst manually categorizes feedback into themes (slow, subjective). 4. Analyst creates summary report with top 5 themes. 5. Remaining 90-95% of comments never analyzed.
constraints: Only 5-10% of comments manually reviewed (missing 90-95% of feedback)
Subjective categorization varies by analyst
Manual review takes weeks to produce insights
No sentiment scoring (positive vs negative unclear)
Themes based on analyst bias not objective data
Long tail issues never surface (only top 5 themes reported)

agentic.workflow: 1. Sentiment Analysis Agent processes 100% of text feedback in real-time using NLP. 2. Agent scores sentiment: positive (7-10), neutral (4-6), negative (1-3). 3. Theme Extraction Agent identifies recurring topics using topic modeling: 'shipping delays', 'product quality', 'customer service'. 4. Agent quantifies theme prevalence and sentiment: 'Shipping delays mentioned in 18% of feedback, 85% negative'. 5. Agent surfaces long-tail issues (mentioned <5% but high negative sentiment).
benefits: 100% feedback coverage vs 5-10% (no blind spots)
95%+ accuracy in theme extraction through objective NLP
Real-time insights vs 2-4 week manual analysis
Sentiment scoring quantifies emotional response
Long-tail issue detection surfaces rare but critical problems
Consistent, objective theme classification (no analyst bias)

quickWins: Deploy sentiment analysis on survey comments
Implement automated theme extraction for top issues
prerequisites: Text analytics platform or NLP API
Sentiment and topic models (pre-trained or custom)

label: NPS & CSAT Monitoring
description: Continuous NPS tracking with real-time dashboards and AI-powered improvement recommendations vs quarterly surveys with 2-3 month reporting lag.

traditional.workflow: 1. Company sends quarterly NPS survey to random customer sample. 2. Survey vendor processes responses and creates report. 3. Report delivered 2-3 months after survey close. 4. Executive team reviews report in quarterly business review. 5. No actionable insights on what to improve or how.
constraints: Quarterly frequency means stale data (reflects 3+ months ago)
2-3 month reporting lag delays action
No segment-level visibility (overall NPS doesn't show problem areas)
No recommendations on how to improve NPS
Report is retrospective (can't course-correct in real-time)
Limited to NPS only (no CSAT, CES, or other metrics)

agentic.workflow: 1. NPS Monitoring Agent continuously collects NPS feedback after key journey moments. 2. Agent calculates real-time NPS by segment: channel, touchpoint, customer type, product category. 3. Improvement Recommendation Agent analyzes detractor feedback to identify improvement opportunities. 4. Agent quantifies impact: 'Improving checkout experience could lift NPS 12 points'. 5. Real-time dashboard shows NPS trends, segment breakdowns, and prioritized improvement actions.
dataSources: Continuous NPS and CSAT survey responses
benefits: Real-time NPS visibility vs 2-3 month lag
Continuous tracking vs quarterly snapshots
Segment-level insights identify specific problem areas
AI-powered recommendations drive targeted improvements
Quantified impact guides investment prioritization
Real-time course correction vs retrospective reporting

quickWins: Implement continuous NPS collection post-key touchpoints
Create real-time NPS dashboard by segment

label: Customer Journey Feedback Attribution
description: Journey-stage-specific feedback with touchpoint attribution enabling precise friction identification and targeted improvements through contextual feedback capture.

traditional.workflow: 1. Post-purchase survey asks 'How was your experience?'. 2. Customer provides generic feedback (good, bad, okay). 3. No context on which journey stage or touchpoint caused positive/negative experience. 4. Product team can't identify where friction occurred. 5. Improvements based on guesswork not specific touchpoint data.
constraints: Generic feedback lacks journey context
Can't pinpoint which touchpoint caused problem
Customer remembers last touchpoint not entire journey
No touchpoint-specific feedback attribution
Unclear whether issue is discovery, checkout, fulfillment, or post-purchase
Product team can't prioritize improvements without specific friction points

agentic.workflow: 1. Journey Attribution Agent tracks customer through journey stages: awareness, consideration, purchase, fulfillment, post-purchase. 2. Agent triggers micro-surveys at each stage with stage-specific questions. 3. Friction Detection Agent analyzes feedback by touchpoint: website navigation (7.2/10), checkout (5.8/10), delivery (8.1/10). 4. Agent identifies precise friction: 'Checkout step 3 payment form causing abandonment'. 5. Touchpoint Mapping links feedback to specific pages, features, and processes.
dataSources: Customer journey path and touchpoint data
Drop-off and abandonment data by touchpoint
benefits: Precise friction identification by journey stage and touchpoint
Targeted improvements based on specific problem areas
Quantified impact: 'Fixing checkout step 3 could reduce abandonment 15%'
Journey-stage context improves feedback quality
Touchpoint scoring enables prioritization (fix 5.8/10 before 7.2/10)
Product team gets actionable, specific improvement guidance

quickWins: Tag feedback with journey stage metadata
prerequisites: Customer Data Platform or journey data

label: Closed-Loop Feedback & Issue Resolution
description: Auto-routing of detractor feedback to service teams with 70-85% issue resolution and follow-up surveys achieving 50-65 pt NPS recovery through systematic closure.

traditional.workflow: 1. Customer gives NPS score of 3 (detractor) and negative comment. 2. Feedback stored in survey database. 3. Quarterly report mentions 'negative feedback on shipping'. 4. No follow-up with customer to resolve issue. 5. Customer remains detractor, likely to churn. 6. 10-20% of detractor issues ever get resolved.
constraints: No follow-up loop with detractors (missed recovery opportunity)
Feedback sits in database unread by service teams
10-20% issue resolution rate (80-90% detractors never contacted)
Customer feels feedback goes into black hole
No tracking of whether issues were resolved
Detractors become churned customers (no recovery attempt)

agentic.workflow: 1. Customer submits NPS score of 0-6 (detractor) with negative feedback. 2. Closed-Loop Agent automatically creates service case and routes to appropriate team. 3. Issue Resolution Agent assigns case to agent with context and priority. 4. Agent contacts customer within 24 hours to resolve issue. 5. Agent tracks resolution outcome and sends follow-up survey. 6. Resolution Tracking measures NPS recovery (detractor to promoter).
dataSources: NPS and CSAT survey responses with scores
NPS recovery and win-back outcome data
benefits: 70-85% issue resolution vs 10-20% (50-65 pt improvement)
100% detractor follow-up vs 10-20% (no feedback ignored)
50-65 pt NPS recovery (detractor 3 becomes promoter 8)
Customer feels heard and valued (closed loop builds trust)
Systematic resolution tracking ensures accountability
Churn prevention through proactive detractor recovery

quickWins: Auto-create service cases for NPS 0-6 scores
prerequisites: Integration between survey platform and case management

label: Predictive VoC Analytics
description: Predictive satisfaction models with 60-80% accuracy enabling proactive experience optimization and issue prevention through forward-looking analytics.

traditional.workflow: 1. Customer completes journey and submits satisfaction survey. 2. Company analyzes retrospective feedback. 3. Product team makes improvements based on past feedback. 4. Improvements deployed months after feedback received. 5. No ability to predict future satisfaction or prevent issues.
constraints: Retrospective analysis shows what already happened (too late)
Reactive improvements deployed months after feedback
No prediction of future satisfaction trends
Can't prevent issues before they impact customers
No early warning system for satisfaction decline
Improvements always lag customer needs

agentic.workflow: 1. Predictive Analytics Agent builds satisfaction prediction models using: behavioral signals, journey patterns, historical feedback, customer attributes. 2. Agent predicts future satisfaction: 'This customer segment likely to have poor delivery experience (65% confidence)'. 3. Experience Optimization Agent recommends proactive improvements before issues occur. 4. Agent simulates impact: 'Improving delivery notifications could prevent 800 detractors this quarter'. 5. Optimization Engine prioritizes preventive actions by predicted impact.
benefits: 60-80% accuracy in predicting future satisfaction trends
Proactive optimization vs reactive improvements
Issue prevention before customers impacted
Early warning system alerts to satisfaction risks
Quantified impact of preventive actions guides investment
Continuous learning improves prediction accuracy over time

quickWins: Build simple satisfaction prediction model for high-risk segments
Implement early warning alerts for NPS decline
